page.title: 02THE TOWN OF TOPSHAM
page.content: Topsham is situated on the Exe estuary, four miles from Exeter. Near the river there are some Dutch style houses, built of Dutch bricks which were traded by merchants a long time ago. In Fore Street, which runs through the centre of Topsham you can see some examples of Tudor buildings. The road is very narrow making it difficult for traffic to pass. It has plenty of public houses for a small town, providing welcome refreshment for travellers. One of Topsham's most modern attractions is a solar heated open air swimming pool, which is run by volunteers.
